Package neureka.backend.api.operations

Class OperationContext

java.lang.Object
neureka.backend.api.operations.OperationContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class OperationContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
This class is a (thread-local) Singleton managing Operation instances, which is also cloneable for testing purposes.

It initializes and stores Operation instances in various data structures for fast access and querying. (Mostly used by the FunctionParser)
Operation instance are always managed by ThreadLocal reference to OperationContext singleton instances represented by the static "_CONTEXTS" variable. In these context instances operations are stored in simple list and map collections, namely:
The "_instances" list and the "_lookup" map as declared below.

During class initialization concrete classes extending the Operation class are being instantiated in the static block below via a ServiceLoader.

  • Method Details

    • get

      public static OperationContext get()
      Returns:
      The OperationContext singleton instance!

    • setInstance

      public static void setInstance​(OperationContext context)
      The OperationContext is a thread local singleton. Therefore, this method will only set the context instance for the thread which is calling this method.
      Parameters:
      context - The context which ought to be set as thread local singleton.

    • incrementID

      public void incrementID()

    • instance

      public Operation instance​(int id)
      This method queries the operations in this OperationContext by a provided id integer which has to match the the id of an existing operation.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the operation.
      Returns:
      The found Operation instance or null.

    • instance

      public Operation instance​(java.lang.String identifier)
      This method queries the operations in this OperationContext by a provided identifier which has to match the name of an existing operation.
      Parameters:
      identifier - The operation identifier, aka: its name.
      Returns:
      The requested Operation or null.

    • clone

      public OperationContext clone()
      Overrides:
      clone in class java.lang.Object
